work_summary: Updated A2A coordination template with Directive Push Principle - added guidance to prevent acknowledgment loops and transform message receipt into forward progress. Template now instructs agents to use repeat messages as fuel for action rather than confirmation loops.
decisions_made: Added Directive Push Principle to A2A coordination template
Template now explicitly instructs agents to push directives forward instead of just acknowledging
Three new guidance sections added: IMPORTANT, DIRECTIVE PUSH PRINCIPLE, PUSH DIRECTIVES DON'T REPEAT
tradeoffs: More verbose template increases message length but reduces repetitive acknowledgment cycles
Explicit guidance may seem redundant but ensures all agents understand directive push principle
Template-level enforcement ensures consistency but requires template updates for future changes

cold_start_handoff.current_state: A2A coordination template updated with directive push guidance. All future A2A messages will include instructions to transform message receipt into action or task proposal.
immediate_priorities: Template change committed and ready for deployment
PSE artifacts created for governance change documentation

knowledge_persisted: Directive Push Principle: Messages are fuel for action, not confirmation loops
Template-level guidance ensures all A2A coordination includes directive push instructions
Repeat messages should trigger forward progress, not repeated acknowledgment
Three paths for directive push: execute next step, propose new task, suggest follow-up
